answers.author: Evelina Moulder
answers.text:
Typically among council-manager communities the city manager is ultimately responsible through his/her department administrators for setting salaries for the staff whom he or she hires or whom the department administrative officers supervise. Although the council may set salary for the city manager as part of the contract negotiations, salaries for other staff should be based on job requirements, qualifications, seniority, salaries for comparable positions in local governments of comparable size and location, and other similar factors.

author: Cynthia Alejo
text: Does anyone know of municipalities with a council-manager form of govt. wherein the Council sets individual salaries (not just salary ranges).  Our municipality is researching this matter, and we do not have labor unions.  Due to current issues with transparancy in government and the economic crisis, we are interested in seeing if there are any cases where this is happening.  Any information on the matter will be most appreciated.
title: Council/Manager Govt. and Staff Salaries
